featured.text: Supporters of casual office wear also argue that a casual dress code helps them save money.
Today David wears casual clothes—khaki pants and a sports shirt—to the office.
This became known as “dress-down Friday” or “casual Friday.”
More and more companies are allowing their office workers to wear casual clothes to work.
In a study conducted by Levi Strauss and Company, 85 percent of employers said that they believe that casual dress improves employee morale.
